TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed CardSpaceSelector extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to all [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] public operations that are supported in managed code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken GetToken(class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CardSpacePolicyElement[] policyChain, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer tokenSerializer) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of that describes the federated security chain that the client requires a final token to unwind.
A that can read a clause.
Docs.summary: Generates a security token using the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] system and the specified policy chain and token serializer.
Docs.returns: A that represents the generated security token.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken GetToken (System.Xml.XmlElement endpoint, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Xml.XmlElement> policy, System.Xml.XmlElement requiredRemoteTokenIssuer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer tokenSerializer);

.method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken GetToken(class System.Xml.XmlElement endpoint, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Xml.XmlElement> policy, class System.Xml.XmlElement requiredRemoteTokenIssuer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer tokenSerializer) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the endpoint address of the recipient where the token is presented.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type that contains a policy fragment that specifies the token types and claims that are requested by the recipient.
An that represents the issuer of the token.
A that can read a clause.
Docs.summary: Generates a security token using the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] system and the specified endpoint, policy, token issuer, and token serializer.
Docs.returns: A that represents the generated security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A security token can be issued by the user or by a third party that is specified by the policy issuer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void Import(string fileName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the file to import.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void Manage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Displays the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] management user interface that allows the user to create, delete, rename, and modify the card.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] does not provide programmatic access to the cards for life-cycle management for privacy and security reasons. For example, you cannot programmatically create, delete, or enumerate cards.
